Sustainable Software: How to design software that is sustainable
text:
Personally, I often saw when visiting several companies that many developers were strongly dependent on ‘Spring’, which was always unfortunate.

Recently, I put together some materials for developers’ education, and I’ll post some of the contents here.

I would appreciate it if you could see this article as one of the ways even if it is obviously not the ideal solution.

https://medium.com/@geminikim/how-to-design-software-that-is-sustainable-9411dc999ecf

title: Tell HN: Idea to End TXT Scams
text:
1) Don't ever send app notifications from alphanumeric senders, only ever send from numeric senders to which the recipient can reply

2) When someone creates a relationship with you, use a similar flow to the "double opt-in" for email subscriptions. You send them a welcome notification, and ask them to save the number in their contacts. ONLY ever send notifications from this number

3) Every TXT ends with "Suspicious message? reply REPEAT to re-send the last message we sent you". The user will get used to seeing those notifications from you.

4) The recipient can then reply REPEAT and your system will always re-send the most recent message. If a scammer spoofed a message with your sender ID (which is trivial) the REPEAT will go back to your number (it's much harder to fraudulently receive messages on a number, than it is to fraudulently send messages from a number) and your system replies with the most recent message. If it differs then the suspicious message can be ignored

Early Stage Founders – Do you attend networking events/dinners?
text:
Does anyone attend these networking events or dinners they get invited to related to market they're targeting? We're pre-rev and working tireless on getting our v.2 product launched, we had one of our colleagues in the VC world introduce us to another VC in our related field who invited us to a dinner event where "apparently" it will have attendee's who are leaders in our target market & investors.

Should we sacrifice our building time to attend this or stick to building to prep for our launch?
